    Load an atomic vector

    loadAtomicVector.Rd

    Load a simple vector consisting of atomic elements from file.

    loadAtomicVector(info, project, ...)

    Arguments

    info

    Named list containing the metadata for this object.

    project

    Any argument accepted by the acquisition functions, see ?acquireFile. By default, this should be a string containing the path to a staging directory.

    ...

    Further arguments, ignored.

    Value

    The vector described by info, possibly with names.

    See also

    "stageObject,integer-method", for one of the staging methods.

    Author

    Aaron Lun

    Examples

    tmp <- tempfile()
dir.create(tmp)
meta <- stageObject(setNames(runif(26), letters), tmp, path="bar")
loadAtomicVector(meta, tmp)
#>          a          b          c          d          e          f          g 
#> 0.30023820 0.32305066 0.02231284 0.85630217 0.02890491 0.09624149 0.64310236 
#>          h          i          j          k          l          m          n 
#> 0.24286169 0.20905423 0.77998908 0.51360842 0.23577732 0.13864953 0.76635888 
#>          o          p          q          r          s          t          u 
#> 0.83408448 0.45810244 0.46825863 0.28132679 0.88083471 0.17438886 0.95124070 
#>          v          w          x          y          z 
#> 0.39964047 0.02164273 0.96770380 0.80353722 0.12873304
